titles.title: Basic Health Program Expansion Act of 2018
A bill to allow States to expand basic health programs to cover more low-income individuals at lower cost.
Basic Health Program Expansion Act of 2018

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

committee.name: Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

bill.summary:
Basic Health Program Expansion Act of 2018
This bill expands eligibility for basic health programs that are established by states (i.e., programs for low-income individuals who do not qualify for Medicaid, the Children's Health Insurance Program (CHIP), or other minimum essential coverage).
